1.text: Hear, ye sons, the instruction of a father, And give attention to know understanding.

2.text: For good learning I have given to you, My law forsake not.

3.text: For, a son I have been to my father—tender, And an only one before my mother.

4.text: And he directeth me, and he saith to me: ‘Let thy heart retain my words, Keep my commands, and live.

5.text: Get wisdom, get understanding, Do not forget, nor turn away From the sayings of my mouth.

6.text: Forsake her not, and she doth preserve thee, Love her, and she doth keep thee.

7.text: The first thing is wisdom—get wisdom, And with all thy getting get understanding.

8.text: Exalt her, and she doth lift thee up, She honoureth thee, when thou dost embrace her.

9.text: She giveth to thy head a wreath of grace, A crown of beauty she doth give thee freely.

10.text: Hear, my son, and receive my sayings, And years of life are multiplied to thee.

11.text: In a way of wisdom I have directed thee, I have caused thee to tread in paths of uprightness.

12.text: In thy walking thy step is not straitened, And if thou runnest, thou stumblest not.

13.text: Lay hold on instruction, do not desist, Keep her, for she is thy life.

14.text: Into the path of the wicked enter not, And be not happy in a way of evil doers.

15.text: Avoid it, pass not over into it, Turn aside from it, and pass on.

16.text: For they sleep not if they do not evil, And their sleep hath been taken violently away, If they cause not some to stumble.

17.text: For they have eaten bread of wickedness, And wine of violence they drink.

18.text: And the path of the righteous is as a shining light, Going and brightening till the day is established,

19.text: The way of the wicked is as darkness, They have not known at what they stumble.

20.text: My son, to my words give attention, To my sayings incline thine ear,

21.text: Let them not turn aside from thine eyes, Preserve them in the midst of thy heart.

22.text: For life they are to those finding them, And to all their flesh healing.

23.text: Above every charge keep thy heart, For out of it are the outgoings of life.

24.text: Turn aside from thee a froward mouth, And perverse lips put far from thee,

25.text: Thine eyes do look straightforward, And thine eyelids look straight before thee.

26.text: Ponder thou the path of thy feet, And all thy ways are established.

27.text: Incline not to the right or to the left, Turn aside thy foot from evil!
